column5: I was recently fishing with a old friend in the Mississippi River and he was useing a bait that I laughed at until he caught Walleye on it. He was useing thin strips of beef liver on a jig. He said that he felt it resembled a worm or a leech and he liked it because it was tough and easy to get. Anybody ever heard of it before???
Native up here use strips of Moose meat on their jigs. Works great.

I've seen corn nibblets, mini-marshmallows, moose strips, pork rinds, chicken pieces and a host of other stuff loaded onto jigs and the users all claimed they worked at one time or another. The fact is, with a little practice a jig can always be placed right into the strike zone and I've never seen anyone outfish a good jig fisher. Jigs have always been the best and least expensive way to land nearly any species of fish.
We've personally used beef heart as bait on jigs - again, because it is very tough to pull off.derrek."I'll teach these eyes to see,beyond these walls in front of me"- Bruce Springsteen, "Trapped"
